com.projetloki.genesis.image

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projetloki.genesis.image.Font
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hashable

    public abstract class Font
extends Object
implements Hashable
    A font with unspecified size. The name font is used here as a synonym for typeface.
    Author:
    Cl√©ment Roux
    See Also:
    FontCatalog, TextShape.TextShape(String, Font, int)

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public static Font load(URL truetypeSource)
                 throws IOException
        Loads a font from the truetype font file at the given URL. Accepted extensions are TTF and OTF.
        Parameters:
        truetypeSource - the URL to load the font from
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during loading

      • load

        public static Font load(File truetypeSource)
                 throws IOException
        Loads a font from the given truetype font file. Accepted extensions are TTF and OTF.
        Parameters:
        truetypeSource - the file to load the front from
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during loading

      • bold

        public abstract Font bold()
        Returns a new font which is a derivative of this font with a bold weight. Calling this method a second time has no effect.

        The algorithm used to make the font bolder may not always produce an esthetic result. For this reason, when a font comes with a native bold variant, e.g. FontCatalog.orbitron() and FontCatalog.orbitronBold(), you should use this native variant instead.

        font font.bold()

      • italic

        public abstract Font italic()
        Returns a new font which is a derivative of this font with the italic style. Calling this method a second time has no effect.

        The algorithm used to make the font italic may not always produce an esthetic result. For this reason, when a font comes with a native italic variant, e.g. FontCatalog.fanwood() and FontCatalog.fanwoodItalic(), you should use this native variant instead.

        font font.italic()
